MLT.SettingAutoSyncTargetsHint: If checked, targeting or detargeting a token will also target or detarget its clones (or originals).
MLT.SettingAutoSyncChatBubblesHint: If checked, chat bubbles for a token will also be shown on its clones (or originals).
MLT.SettingCloneModuleFlags: Clone token flags set by other modules
MLT.SettingCloneModuleFlagsHint: Modules can set custom flags on tokens for their own use. If checked, cloned tokens will inherit such flags from the original. Since the purpose of these flags depends on the module in question, I can't tell you what this option will do, but if cloned tokens are interacting poorly with some other module, you can try changing it.
MLT.TabNotes: Use this Drawing to define a region for automation with Multilevel Tokens.
MLT.SectionTeleportsNotes: Tokens moving into an In region will be teleported to an Out region with a matching identifier.
MLT.FieldActivateViaMapNoteNotes: Tokens within the In region will be teleported only when their owner (or a GM) clicks on a Map Note within the region.
MLT.FieldSnapToGridNotes: Tokens will be snapped to the grid when teleporting to this Out region.
MLT.FieldSceneLocalNotes: Restrict teleport and cloning regions to match only with other regions on the same scene.
MLT.SectionTokenCloningNotes: Tokens will be cloned from Source regions to any Target regions with matching identifiers.
MLT.SectionTargetRegionNotes: Settings for cloned tokens created by this Target region.
MLT.SectionMacroTriggersNotes: Trigger a macro when a token enters this region, leaves it, or moves within it. Within the macro, the variables scene, region, token and actor give the Scene, Drawing, Token and Actor objects involved.
MLT.SectionMacroEventsNotes: Within the macro, the event variable will take one of the values MLT.ENTER, MLT.LEAVE, or MLT.MOVE.
MLT.FieldAdditionalArgumentsNotes: Comma-separated, available in the args variable within your macro.
MLT.SectionLevelsNotes: Tokens moving onto a @stairs token will be teleported to any other @stairs token at the same relative position within a numerically-adjacent level region.
MLT.FieldDisableRegionNotes: Temporarily disable all automation features for this region.
